Fantasy 











 





Ducks in a row
 




Dustin Penner celebrates his game-winning goal in the third.  (AP)



      
    

    

      
      Spurred by bad blood, Ottawa dominates early, only to retreat as Anaheim finishes 
      strong to win 3-2 in Game 4. The Ducks are simply better, and 
      barring further miscues, the Stanley 
      Cup is theirs, Wes Goldstein says.
    

  
 Related Links:• Alfredsson ruckus | Penner stands tall | McAmmond out | Pronger sits• Finals | Notes | GMs meet | Blogs: Goldstein: What's up, Alfie? | Dodd


 


 

 





 DEI is toast? Don't tell that to Dover winner Truex Jr.


    

      
      Ah, relief for embattled DEI at last. Martin Truex Jr. delivers what 
      Dale Jr. hasn't in 2007 -- a big victory. Pete Pistone says Truex 
      is eyeing the Chase 
      -- and a leadership role.
    

  
• Truex wins first race | Results | Blog | Chase | Notes


 

 





 As Donovan ducks out of Orlando, Magic left scrambling


    

      
      Billy Donovan's NBA coaching career -- 'Hello. Oops. Bye!' And while 
      Gators in Gainesville will be thrilled, there 
      will not be a similar reaction from Orlando, Tony Mejia 
      says.
    

  
• Working out an exit | Ratto | Parrish | FreeStyle | Yo!
